subject: Season Four, Foreshadowed
event:
For you poor benighted souls who do not [yet] have HBO, here's the Foreshadowing that was broadcast earlier tonight, just before the latest [terrific] episode of TRUE DETECTIVE:

<lj-embed id="403" />

Enjoy.

But, as with past previews, please do not analyze or dissect or argue about the preview here.  That's what Tower of the Hand and Winter Is Coming and Westeros and Television Without Pity are for.  (And lots of other swell sites and blogs and bulletin boards as well, sorry I could not mention you all).

For more, alas, you will need to wait until season four debuts on April 6.  (Unless you happen to live in Santa Fe... )

comments.article: I got chills when I saw it! I'm just so excited to watch the characters develop. ...and that's not all: we bought season 3 tonight a our Valentine gift to each other! We are poor Netflixers so haven't seen it yet...were waiting waiting for the release. :)
The last 10 minutes of True Detective were some of the best TV i've ever seen, Glad you watch it :)
comments.subject: True Detective

comments.article: I'll echo that.  I was amazed at how well executed that long take was.  This truly is the golden age of television.
comments.subject: Re: True Detective

comments.article:
I just want to say that this show is amazing!!! Thank you for writing these stories and for the care you all put into making this series. I just love it.

It's going to take some time getting used to the new Daario because I really liked the last one. If it was an ethnicity issue, then I think darkening up his hair and maybe putting a blue streak in it would have worked. If it's something else, then I hope all works out.

Anyway, April 6th can't get here soon enough!
Awesome!! OMG, Drogon looks great!
Speechless
Thank you very much, Mr Martin. Much appreciated.

Awesome preview! I will get another copy of book 3 (gave away the old one) right now and read it again to get ready for the new season.

It would be even cooler though if there were some new chapters from Winds of Winter.

I would even pay for them. Really.

Just give us something. Please!!!
comments.subject: Awesome preview but ...

comments.article: Looks incredible! I cant believe it has been going on long enough for Bran to change like that! I didn't recognize him!
comments.subject: Things are changing!

comments.article: Please convey my thanks to HBO for their wonderful programming - but, if it were not for GOT I would still be pirating their shows instead of paying for them.
comments.subject: HBO

comments.article:
The Jaime Lannister Power Hour approaches!

Can't wait for the new season. Just four days before my birthday too. Gonna be a good week. Captain America: Winter Soldier, money, and then GoT...sheer perfection.

Will as last year Season 5 approval be announced after first episode of 4?

And actually are there any plans for Season 5?
comments.subject: season 5

comments.article: And there's of course the Youtube comment section for dissecting and analysing :)
Looks like they might have already started on the Dance with Dragons material. Maybe let them know they're going too fast?
comments.subject: Uh-oh...

comments.article: Looking forward to diving in....  Season 4 looks awesome!
Just finished "Dance with Dragons". And I love it. World of Ice and Fire is fantastic, can't wait for "Winds of winter".
I love hearing from the actors outside their roles.
Please let Arya Stark live until the last book of A Song of Ice and Fire series! Please! Please! Please!
comments.subject: Arya

comments.article: Well, that's very risky...
comments.subject: Re: Arya

comments.article:
Just waiting to see the red viper.. One of the bests parts in the book! red viper teach me so much about life and revenge.. I see parts of dance in the next season, i hope they do not get closer to the book so much. And george, thank you so much for answer my messgge!

PD: I'm about to convince my girlfriend that our first son will be named Eddard.
comments.subject: Just waiting

comments.article: I have to say I'm very excited to see the next season. I was recently going through some old family photos(everything from the late 1800's to early 1900's) and stumbled across a fantastic picture. It's of my great aunt as a small child and her pet wolf (which was apparently named Buddy). I guess I know now why I identify with house Stark more than any other family from Game of Thrones. My family has always had a strong connection with animals. Would have loved to link it here but it seems I can't- thought you would get a kick out of it.
Looks brilliant. Season 4 will kick some ass, that's for sure. So many highlights!

Thanks for the link. I have to wonder about the weirdest thing YOU'VE had to do with regards to the series, GRRM.

-Jared

I had to don a gigantic hat and a big necklace of golden balls for my cameo appearance as a Pentoshi merchant at Dany's wedding. Beard extensions too.

Unfortunately, my entire scowling performance was left on the cutting room floor when the entire Morocco wedding sequence was cut, and reshot in Malta.

Hi, I am from India and would really love to see a Hindi version (not dubbed )of Game of Thrones provided HBO thinks of setting up a Hindi channel in India. It's such a huge market and television is in a rut here.Was just imagining if Game of Thrones could be made in Hindi with all the top actors from Bollywood acting in it, that would be ten on ten.
Winterfell can be Kashmir, Casterly Rock can be Gujarat, Dorne can be Kerala,Pyke could be Sri Lanka and so on. The Others (Whitewalkers ) may emerge from the other side of the Himalayas and what bigger Wall than the Himalayas. Just letting my mind meander ............
comments.subject: Truly speechless

comments.article:
I don't know how many times I'll quote Bart Scott's infamous rant by saying "CAN'T WAIT" today.

Countless?

Countless has a nice ring to it.
comments.subject: Can't wait

comments.article: Loved it! My wife screamed "Look at the Dragon" at the end! :)
